subject: Ethics
title: Mutually Assured Destruction Logic
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Mutually Assured Destruction Logic.

hook.text: For 40 years, the world's survival depended on a bluff: 'If you nuke us, we'll nuke you back.'

buildup.text: MADâ€”mutually assured destructionâ€”kept peace by making nuclear war suicidal for both sides.

discovery.text: The logic works only if both sides believe the other will actually retaliate, even after being hit.

twist.text: MAD requires leaders to be rational. A single unstable leader or false alarm could end civilization.

climax.text: In 1983, a Soviet officer detected a U.S. missile launch. He chose not to retaliate. It was a glitch.

punchline.text: We survived the Cold War on luck, not logic.

quiz.question: What critical assumption does mutually assured destruction rely on?
options: That both sides will always have equal numbers of nuclear weapons
That nuclear weapons can be used without causing lasting radiation
That both sides' leaders will always act rationally
